title: Tanks are actually punchingballs with the only utility to stun and to r ...
body:
In the past Riot made tanks to counter ad melee fighters and ad assassins.

Nowadays if you play full tank you better farm and can't trade against an ad melee fighter without getting obliterated.

Is that normal that a Malphite with 620 armor gets 1500 of true damage against a fiora or kha zix. I mean aren't tanks made to counter the ad fighters ? Because in the past that was their role. 

by counter i mean it wont do a lot of damage to you but if you fight too long against him you have no chance because of resistance and high health.

It seems that now tanks are completely useless in laning phase and their job is only to r in teamfights and to be the punchingball...

Tanks are dead meat that's the only way riot sees us actually.

It's sad that a class that owned so much importance in the game is slowly getting put in the utility plan only.

replies.body: I play tanks all the time and never feel this way. Tanks are meant to be countered by juggernaut and skirmishers because they will be useful in teamfights even if they fall behind in gold. After you see that {{champion:36}} {{champion:14}} are very resilient in most matchups. {{champion:98}} goes toe to toe with {{champion:92}} {{champion:114}} . {{champion:54}} even counters {{champion:92}} {{champion:62}} and some other ad fighters. This is prohibiting proplayers taking other options other than tanks in top lane, and is unhealthy.
Tanks were meant to counter skirmishers in the past but riot changed everything...

Tanks were meant to counter burst and be peel and initiation. Skirmishers are not burst, they're DPS.

The only thing a tank is really meant to do against a skirmisher is keep them off of the ADC and help people land skillshots. They can lock them down, sure, but honestly a mage or assassin does that just as effectively and *also* kills the skirmisher.

Theres a difference with tanks being good in low elo, and tanks being good in high ELO. In gold, you could technically get away with playing any toplane tank and not get punished for it. In Diamond+, if you are anything but Sion or Cho, your ass about to be grass real quick.
And as for pro play, top laners pick tanks mostly because it provides a good frontline, where as if they were some squish damage dealer, they would die in seconds and provide nothing for their team in fights.

Why should a tank win against a Fiora? Why should a tank win vs a fighter who excels in 1v1s/splitpush and is mediocre in teamfights, and then the same tank should be a team fight monster? That doesn't make any sense. Tanks are team fight monsters, their trade off is a weaker 1v1. They can't do it all, its just logic.
Tanks like Garen that are nasty and a disease to play against are a disease but tanks that are fun to play and play against like Hecarim and Ornn are awesome.

Garen isn't a tank though. He's a fighter. 

But yes, he is still a bullshit champ to play against.

Specifically, he's a *juggernaut*.

The definitions between tank classes or mage classes aren't as important as those between fighters and divers. {{champion:201}} and {{champion:89}} are somewhat similar in function (their job is to use CC and protect people, even if they're stronger in slightly different ways), but a {{champion:75}} is absolutely nothing like a {{champion:5}} (where the only similarity is that they can both 1v3 and win).

>Nowadays if you play full tank you better farm and can't trade

And then you singlehandedly win a team fight for your team because you have the strongest AoE CC in the game.

Your statement there is the epitome of why League sucks now more than ever, boiled down into a single statement. Tanks peak offensively at like 6-7000 gold and more or less always have. In other words 2 or 3 items and boots. Past there you let your carries do the rest.

Why do tanks have to be able to trade in lane? Why do they **have** to deal enough damage to kill their opponent? Can't they just be a setup artist? Honestly, what is wrong with that philosophy?

If you want a tank that deals damage instead of having big CC, pick a juggernaut.

I mean if you want tanks to kill their opponents without hurting them, it’s on you. I’m not sure if it’d be balanced if Malphite killed you by standing in lane. 


As for why they have to trade in lane, it allows them to be interactive instead of sandbagging the lane.  Otherwise, they might as well stay as supports than top and jungle.

Old shen had really reliable healing and a relatively short CD escape. I think that's a pretty big edge case. He was top tier in pro play forever because he had everything and no mana constraints.

I'm saying that while it might not be good for spectators, farm lanes make for a genuinely better and more consistent mid and late game for everyone.

The current hyper aggressive early game is more fun to watch, but from a player's standpoint it's utterly exhausting and it removes distinct phases of the game, as the entire thing might as well be a massive deathmatch.

When people say that LoL sucks now, it's almost entirely because of that philosophy. Damage is high enough at all points of the game right now that there's basically always a 100-0 scenario. The damage has been added to shorten the game and make it more exciting to watch. But it just makes the game shitty to play because any lane could turn into an all you can eat buffet before you've even established yourself in lane, and the game is over before it even starts.

But then they need to lose something else. 
Can't be like right now where tanks outsustain, outtrade, outwaveclear you and scale monstrous into teamfights.

Tanks generally don’t have as much healing mechanics as fighters. 

Except Maokai and Cho, but _fuck_ Maokai and Cho.

Playing Talon vs Malphite
I got first blood, had a pre good cs lead against him
Didn't matter. He just build frozen heart, had over 300 armor. My w-q barely broke his shield.
Tanks to support role only soon.
Wait Malphite has unusually strong melee-dueling for a tank, he's like the worst possible example.

I seriously would love to see a Kha'Zix beat a Malphite with 620 armor. Definitely. A fiora doing what, meanwhile, she's supposed, %true damage counters resistences and HP after all.
Also, yes thats is what TANKS are supposed to be. I still have nightmares of the past seasons where tanks would literally build pure defense and would still outdamage you (not like it doesn't happen nowdays, just less frequently). People that remenber the meta of rushing {{item:3025}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3065}} and be unkillable and kill everyone know what I am talking about.

in which world is a tank unable to trade a melee fighter

what the actual fuck jesus
Try to play against fiora

the champ that deals x15 less damage than tanks in lane right now?

yea, I try it's SOOOOOOO HARDD

Finally someone comes out with a post that speaks volumes to what most tanks are.
Riot was forced to make tanks "dead meat" because of the community's reason of hating them last year: They are "boring" to play or play against.
I for one like playing tanks like Ornn and Maokai vs playing some damage dealer that has to snowball or becomes useless (Aatrox).
it's boring to get fucking oneshotted by every damn champ on the enemy team
Meanwhile, there were no cases of absolute one shots in the tank meta. Makes you wonder if the tank meta wasn't actually that bad as the community perceives it as.

Tank meta had a one glaring problem. Tanks were directly crowding out fighters/skirmishers out of top and jungle, and indirectly making assassins useless. In tank meta basically two people were playing tanks, two people were playing carries, and one support. That's why mid and ADC players loved tank meta. They were the carries. Thats why tops and junglers didn't like the meta. They couldn't carry.
Yeah, but who said we couldn't simply nerf tank items. Instead we had to add multiple ways of making a tank feel useless as shit because the community wanted tanks to die.

Current tanks items feel like shit too, i don't feel any of them being useful outside of Stoneplate active and Warmogs passive. I don't think i have bought Randuins/DMP/SV/Sunfire on any tank in last three months.

Thats because of the "multiple ways" I mentioned. We have not only IE giving every AD access to true damage, but LW can shred armor effectively now, and Conqueror exists as a godcounter to tanks for any Bruiser and Draven. If we got rid of the true damage from both, the items would seem more effective.

And yet a taric with censer and knightsvow facetanks a darius for 20 seconds with conq, bc, steraks and i die. 
Tanks are so insanely broken and conq is literally a bandaid so bruisers don't automatically lose the moment they are picked.
"Insanely broken" Then why is Ornn in the gutter, while Sion and Cho are the last and only tanks being played in top?
I wonder why people hate unkillable monstrosities that have zero skill input and kill about anyone on the map.
Meanwhile we live in a zero skill one shot era currently. Its not that different at all.

Tanks should exist to protect your teammates, they ain't real fighters and never will be. The damage they do is only to generate threat and weaken the enemy team enough so offensive classes can get a kill. That or that they have enough CC to completely lockdown their target so they can be blown up. For tanks its Durability > CC = damage = Mobility > utility  for  Vanguards and for wardens it's Durability > utility = CC = Mobility > damage. 


Generally speaking tanks should be a counter for all carries and mages, but weak to fighters as they have enough durability to survive and fight back. Also, tanks in general have burst damage as it would help them in the laning phase during trading but in teamfights they will have lost their damage and have to focus on peeling or CC'ing the enemy team.

When tanks are strong and can trade and beat fighters in lane, fighters have no place top, if a tank outdamages/out duels a fighter, then picking a tank will always be better because tanks are also teamfighting monsters and bring a lot more than just damage (unlike fighters).

Amumu and nunu are super tanky once they get some items. Sion is very tanky and does decent damage aswell. There's not many tank doing fine but those surely do tank properly. I'm using conditioning on tanks now and it does help a lot honestly. 

About tanks countering skirmisher, I'm not sure. I don't recall a moment where they were set to be a counter to them, on the contrary because of the sustain damage and lifesteal. There's two types of tanks, those who are meant to initiate and be the frontline aka Vanguards and those who're more support-based aka Wardens. 

The Vanguards typically have CC but also have enough damage to be relevant threats to backlines for example amumu and malphite. Then, you've the Wardens that are rather meant to peel and disrupt fights whos kit heavily rely on hard CC such as braum or leona. 

If any, Wardens would be the most approriate to counter fighters/slayers but only if they're combined with a DPS.

This post speaks the truth, I am tired of having 3500 health, 300 armor, and a shield.  Get into fight get killed in 2.5 seconds. Look at damage, more than half my health in true damage. People who say building health counters true damage are not playing the same game as me. 
If I spend all my gold on tank items I should be able to stay alive for more than 5 seconds in a fight. Instead I get oneshot like I was playing an assassin.  No wonder everyone just plays damage champs now, either way you die in under 3 seconds might as well burst someone before you go.
